verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face toward Jerusalem, and drop thy word toward the holy places, and prophesy against the land of Israel,
verses.web: “Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem, and preach toward the sanctuaries, and prophesy against the land of Israel.
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn your face toward Jerusalem. Speak out against the holy places and prophesy against the land of Israel.

verses.kjv: And say to the land of Israel, Thus saith the LORD; Behold, I am against thee, and will draw forth my sword out of his sheath, and will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked.
verses.web: Tell the land of Israel, ‘LORD says: “Behold, I am against you, and will draw my sword out of its sheath, and will cut off from you the righteous and the wicked.
verses.ct: Tell the land of Israel, 'This is what the LORD says: I am against you. I will draw my sword from its sheath and cut off both the righteous and the wicked from among you.

verses.kjv: Seeing then that I will cut off from thee the righteous and the wicked, therefore shall my sword go forth out of his sheath against all flesh from the south to the north:
verses.web: Seeing then that I will cut off from you the righteous and the wicked, therefore my sword will go out of its sheath against all flesh from the south to the north.
verses.ct: Because I will cut off both the righteous and the wicked, my sword will strike everyone from south to north.

verses.kjv: That all flesh may know that I the LORD have drawn forth my sword out of his sheath: it shall not return any more.
verses.web: All flesh will know that I, LORD, have drawn my sword out of its sheath. It will not return any more.” ’
verses.ct: Then everyone will know that I, the LORD, have drawn my sword. It will not go back into its sheath again.'"

verses.kjv: Sigh therefore, thou son of man, with the breaking of thy loins; and with bitterness sigh before their eyes.
verses.web: “Therefore sigh, you son of man. You shall sigh before their eyes with a broken heart and with bitterness.
verses.ct: "So groan, son of man! Groan in front of them with a broken heart and bitter anguish.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, when they say unto thee, Wherefore sighest thou? that thou shalt answer, For the tidings; because it cometh: and every heart shall melt, and all hands shall be feeble, and every spirit shall faint, and all knees shall be weak as water: behold, it cometh, and shall be brought to pass, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: It shall be, when they ask you, ‘Why do you sigh?’ that you shall say, ‘Because of the news, for it comes! Every heart will melt, all hands will be feeble, every spirit will faint, and all knees will be weak as water. Behold, it comes, and it shall be done, says the Lord LORD.’ ”
verses.ct: When they ask you, 'Why are you groaning?' tell them, 'Because of the news that's coming. When it arrives, every heart will melt, every hand will go limp, every spirit will grow faint, and every knee will turn to water. It's coming — and it will happen,' declares the Lord GOD."

verses.kjv: Again the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus saith the LORD; Say, A sword, a sword is sharpened, and also furbished:
verses.web: “Son of man, prophesy, and say, ‘LORD says: “A sword! A sword! It is sharpened, and also polished.
verses.ct: "Son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the LORD says: A sword! A sword — sharpened and polished!

verses.kjv: It is sharpened to make a sore slaughter; it is furbished that it may glitter: should we then make mirth? it contemneth the rod of my son, as every tree.
verses.web: It is sharpened that it may make a slaughter. It is polished that it may be as lightning. Should we then make mirth? The rod of my son condemns every tree.
verses.ct: It is sharpened for slaughter, polished to flash like lightning. Should we celebrate? The sword despises the ruling scepter of my son, treating it like any ordinary stick.

verses.kjv: And he hath given it to be furbished, that it may be handled: this sword is sharpened, and it is furbished, to give it into the hand of the slayer.
verses.web: It is given to be polished, that it may be handled. The sword is sharpened. Yes, it is polished to give it into the hand of the killer.” ’
verses.ct: The sword has been polished so it can be gripped. It has been sharpened and gleaming — ready to be placed in the killer's hand.'

verses.kjv: Cry and howl, son of man: for it shall be upon my people, it shall be upon all the princes of Israel: terrors by reason of the sword shall be upon my people: smite therefore upon thy thigh.
verses.web: Cry and wail, son of man; for it is on my people. It is on all the princes of Israel. They are delivered over to the sword with my people. Therefore beat your thigh.
verses.ct: Cry out and wail, son of man, because this sword is coming against my people — against all the leaders of Israel. They will be thrown to the sword along with my people. So beat your chest in grief.

verses.kjv: Because it is a trial, and what if the sword contemn even the rod? it shall be no more, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: “For there is a trial. What if even the rod that condemns will be no more?” says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: "This is a test. And what if even the scepter that the sword despises ceases to exist?" declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Thou therefore, son of man, prophesy, and smite thine hands together, and let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword of the slain: it is the sword of the great men that are slain, which entereth into their privy chambers.
verses.web: “You therefore, son of man, prophesy, and strike your hands together. Let the sword be doubled the third time, the sword of the fatally wounded. It is the sword of the great one who is fatally wounded, which enters into their rooms.
verses.ct: "So prophesy, son of man! Clap your hands together. Let the sword strike twice — even 3 times! It is a sword of slaughter, a massive blade of death that closes in on them from every side.

verses.kjv: I have set the point of the sword against all their gates, that their heart may faint, and their ruins be multiplied: ah! it is made bright, it is wrapped up for the slaughter.
verses.web: I have set the threatening sword against all their gates, that their heart may melt, and their stumblings be multiplied. Ah! It is made as lightning. It is pointed for slaughter.
verses.ct: I have aimed the flashing sword at every gate so that hearts will melt and casualties will pile up. It gleams like lightning — it is drawn and ready for slaughter.

verses.kjv: Go thee one way or other, either on the right hand, or on the left, whithersoever thy face is set.
verses.web: Gather yourselves together. Go to the right. Set yourselves in array. Go to the left, wherever your face is set.
verses.ct: Slash to the right! Slash to the left! Strike wherever you are aimed!

verses.kjv: I will also smite mine hands together, and I will cause my fury to rest: I the LORD have said it.
verses.web: I will also strike my hands together, and I will cause my wrath to rest. I, LORD, have spoken it.”
verses.ct: Then I too will clap my hands together, and my fury will be satisfied. I, the LORD, have spoken."

verses.kjv: The word of the LORD came unto me again, saying,
verses.web: LORD’s word came to me again, saying,
verses.ct: The word of the LORD came to me again:

verses.kjv: Also, thou son of man, appoint thee two ways, that the sword of the king of Babylon may come: both twain shall come forth out of one land: and choose thou a place, choose it at the head of the way to the city.
verses.web: “Also, you son of man, appoint two ways, that the sword of the king of Babylon may come. They both will come out of one land, and mark out a place. Mark it out at the head of the way to the city.
verses.ct: "Son of man, mark out 2 roads for the sword of the king of Babylon to travel. Both roads start from the same country. Then set up a signpost where the road forks toward the city.

verses.kjv: Appoint a way, that the sword may come to Rabbath of the Ammonites, and to Judah in Jerusalem the defenced.
verses.web: You shall appoint a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and to Judah in Jerusalem the fortified.
verses.ct: Mark one road for the sword to reach Rabbah of the Ammonites, and the other to reach Judah and fortified Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination: he made his arrows bright, he consulted with images, he looked in the liver.
verses.web: For the king of Babylon stood at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination. He shook the arrows back and forth. He consulted the teraphim. He looked in the liver.
verses.ct: The king of Babylon will stand at the fork in the road where the 2 paths split, and he will seek omens. He will shake arrows, consult his household idols, and examine a liver for signs.

verses.kjv: At his right hand was the divination for Jerusalem, to appoint captains, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to appoint battering rams against the gates, to cast a mount, and to build a fort.
verses.web: In his right hand was the lot for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, and to build forts.
verses.ct: The omen in his right hand will point toward Jerusalem. He will set up battering rams, give the order to attack, raise the battle cry, position rams against the gates, build siege ramps, and construct assault towers.

verses.kjv: And it shall be unto them as a false divination in their sight, to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembrance the iniquity, that they may be taken.
verses.web: It will be to them as a false divination in their sight, who have sworn oaths to them; but he brings iniquity to memory, that they may be taken.
verses.ct: The people of Jerusalem — who had sworn treaties with Babylon — will think this is a false omen. But the king of Babylon will remind them of their guilt, and they will be captured.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Because ye have made your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are discovered, so that in all your doings your sins do appear; because, I say, that ye are come to remembrance, ye shall be taken with the hand.
verses.web: “Therefore the Lord LORD says: ‘Because you have caused your iniquity to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your doings your sins appear; because you have come to memory, you will be taken with the hand.
verses.ct: "So this is what the Lord GOD says: Because you have brought your guilt out into the open — your rebellion exposed, your sin on display in everything you do — because you have been called to account, you will be seized by force.

verses.kjv: And thou, profane wicked prince of Israel, whose day is come, when iniquity shall have an end,
verses.web: “ ‘You, deadly wounded wicked one, the prince of Israel, whose day has come, in the time of the iniquity of the end,
verses.ct: And as for you, you corrupt and wicked prince of Israel — your day has come, the time when your sin will finally be punished.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; Remove the diadem, and take off the crown: this shall not be the same: exalt him that is low, and abase him that is high.
verses.web: the Lord LORD says: “Remove the turban, and take off the crown. This will not be as it was. Exalt that which is low, and humble that which is high.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: Take off the turban. Remove the crown. Nothing will stay as it was. The lowly will be raised up, and the powerful will be brought down.

verses.kjv: I will overturn, overturn, overturn, it: and it shall be no more, until he come whose right it is; and I will give it him.
verses.web: I will overturn, overturn, overturn it. This also will be no more, until he comes whose right it is; and I will give it.” ’
verses.ct: Ruin! Ruin! I will make it a ruin! And it will remain that way until the one comes who has the right to it — and I will give it to him."

verses.kjv: And thou, son of man, prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord GOD concerning the Ammonites, and concerning their reproach; even say thou, The sword, the sword is drawn: for the slaughter it is furbished, to consume because of the glittering:
verses.web: “You, son of man, prophesy, and say, ‘The Lord LORD says this concerning the children of Ammon, and concerning their reproach: “A sword! A sword is drawn! It is polished for the slaughter, to cause it to devour, that it may be as lightning;
verses.ct: "Now, son of man, prophesy and say, 'This is what the Lord GOD says about the Ammonites and their mockery: A sword! A sword is drawn — polished for slaughter, ready to devour, flashing like lightning!

verses.kjv: Whiles they see vanity unto thee, whiles they divine a lie unto thee, to bring thee upon the necks of them that are slain, of the wicked, whose day is come, when their iniquity shall have an end.
verses.web: while they see for you false visions, while they divine lies to you, to lay you on the necks of the wicked who are deadly wounded, whose day has come in the time of the iniquity of the end.
verses.ct: While your prophets feed you false visions and lying predictions, the sword will fall on the necks of the wicked who are marked for death — those whose day has come, the time when their sin will finally be punished.

verses.kjv: Shall I cause it to return into his sheath? I will judge thee in the place where thou wast created, in the land of thy nativity.
verses.web: Cause it to return into its sheath. In the place where you were created, in the land of your birth, I will judge you.
verses.ct: Put the sword back in its sheath! I will judge you right where you were made, in the land where you were born.

verses.kjv: And I will pour out mine indignation upon thee, I will blow against thee in the fire of my wrath, and deliver thee into the hand of brutish men, and skilful to destroy.
verses.web: I will pour out my indignation on you. I will blow on you with the fire of my wrath. I will deliver you into the hand of brutish men, skillful to destroy.
verses.ct: I will pour out my fury on you. I will blast you with the fire of my anger and hand you over to savage men who are experts at destruction.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt be for fuel to the fire; thy blood shall be in the midst of the land; thou shalt be no more remembered: for I the LORD have spoken it.
verses.web: You will be for fuel to the fire. Your blood will be in the middle of the land. You will be remembered no more; for I, LORD, have spoken it.” ’ ”
verses.ct: You will become fuel for the fire. Your blood will soak your own land. You will be remembered no more — for I, the LORD, have spoken."
